Jessica Moreno

jessicaamorenoo23@gmail.com

Hi! My name is Jessica Moreno, and I am an undergraduate student at Lewis University in Romeoville, Illinois. I am currently pursuing my Bachelor of Elementary Education and expect to obtain my teaching license for the state of Illinois by December 2020. For part of my undergraduate degree, I received a Learning Behavior Specialist endorsement. Also as part of my undergraduate degree I received my Associate of Arts from the College of DuPage in Glen Ellyn, Illinois. â€‹I am currently student teaching 3rd grade at Kendall Elementary School in Naperville, Illinois and am enjoying every moment of it!

Teaching Philosophy

I believe that children deserve an education that is tailored to each of their needs as much as possible. I understand that every student is unique and learns in different ways and at different paces. Therefore, I make it my goal to meet students where they are and lead them towards success in every aspect of their education. I endeavor to create an atmosphere where children are comfortable to ask questions, unafraid to make mistakes, eager to discover, and challenged to go above and beyond their goals and expectations. It is my hope that my students will never want to stop learning!

    Interests

    Apart from being a web developer, I enjoy most of my time being outdoors. In the winter, I am an avid skier and novice ice climber. During the warmer months here in Colorado, I enjoy mountain biking, free climbing, and kayaking.

    When forced indoors, I follow a number of sci-fi and fantasy genre movies and television shows, I am an aspiring chef, and I spend a large amount of my free time exploring the latest technology advancements in the front-end web development world.
